title: D1. Little String (Easy Version)
statement:
This is the
easy
version of the problem. The difference between the versions is that in this version, it is guaranteed that the string $$$s$$$ does not contain the character
?
.
For the string $$$w_1w_2 \ldots w_n$$$, consisting of characters
0
and
1
, we define $$$f(w)$$$ as the number of permutations $$$p_1, p_2, \ldots, p_n$$$ of the array $$$[0, 1, \ldots, n-1]$$$, such that for all $$$i$$$ from $$$1$$$ to $$$n$$$ the following holds:
if $$$w_i = \texttt{1}$$$, then there exist such $$$1 \leq l \leq r \leq n$$$ that $$$\operatorname{mex}([p_l, p_{l+1}, \ldots, p_r]) = i$$$;$$$^{\text{∗}}$$$
if $$$w_i = \texttt{0}$$$, then there do not exist such $$$1 \leq l \leq r \leq n$$$ that $$$\operatorname{mex}([p_l, p_{l+1}, \ldots, p_r]) = i$$$.
Given a string $$$s_1s_2 \ldots s_n$$$, consisting of characters
0
and
1
, and a positive integer $$$c$$$.
Note that in this version of the problem, the string $$$s$$$ doesn't contain
?
. Consider all strings $$$w$$$ that can be obtained from $$$s$$$ by replacing all characters
?
with characters
0
and
1
. Find the smallest value of $$$f(w)$$$ among all such strings $$$w$$$ that is not divisible by $$$c$$$, or determine that such a string $$$w$$$ does not exist. Since the answer may be large, find it modulo $$$10^9+7$$$.
$$$^{\text{∗}}$$$The minimum excluded (MEX) of a collection of integers $$$c_1, c_2, \ldots, c_k$$$ is defined as the smallest non-negative integer $$$x$$$ which does not occur in the collection $$$c$$$.
inputSpecification:
Input
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^4$$$). The description of the test cases follows.
The first line of each test case contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$c$$$ ($$$3 \leq n \leq 2 \cdot 10^5$$$, $$$1 \leq c \leq 10^9$$$) — the length of the string and the number that limits the value of the function.
The second line of each test case contains a string of length $$$n$$$, consisting of characters
0
and
1
— the string $$$s$$$.
It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ across all test cases does not exceed $$$2 \cdot 10^5$$$.
outputSpecification:
Output
For each test case, if there exists such a string $$$w$$$ that can be obtained from $$$s$$$ by replacing all characters
?
with characters
0
and
1
, such that $$$f(w)$$$ is not divisible by $$$c$$$, then output the minimum value of $$$f(w)$$$ among all such strings $$$w$$$. The answer should be output modulo $$$10^9+7$$$. If such a string does not exist, output $$$-1$$$.
